titleproper.value: Guide to the Records of NYU Shanghai <num>RG.50</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-13T19:36:48</date>

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box and 1 half manuscript box

abstract.value: New York University Shanghai (NYU Shanghai) is a university established jointly by New York University and East China Normal University of Shanghai in 2012. The student population is approximately 1,300 undergraduate and graduate students, about half of whom are from China. The Records of NYU Shanghai consists of materials documenting the school's campus, courses, and students. Materials in this collection include ephemera, course catalogs, and other publications dated approximately 2013-2018.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Records of NYU Shanghai; RG.50; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

There is no documentation concerning the provenance of this collection. In January 2020 an accretion of publications and ephemera was transferred to the University Archives by Ree DeDonato, Adjunct Librarian for Abu Dhabi Collections; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2020.008.

New York University Shanghai (NYU Shanghai) is a university established jointly by New York University and East China Normal University of Shanghai in 2012. The student population is approximately 1,300 undergraduate and graduate students, about half of whom are from China.

The Records of NYU Shanghai consists of materials documenting the school's campus, courses, and students. Materials in this collection include ephemera, course catalogs, and other publications dated approximately 2013-2018.
